vbrodsky7 wrote:

>
> How can I configurea form post to be a seed?
>
> For example if I want to crawl search results, my seed would be a
> search form.

Our crawler doesn't do POST as part of normal operation. It can do a 
POST of login credentials so you might try exploiting the auth system 
faking it into POSTing a search query to get your list of seeds (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#credentials, in 
particular section 6.4.2).

If you are considering google as the search engine you want to crawl for 
seeds, you might instead go via the google API especially considering 
they deny crawlers access to search (See their robots.txt).

Hope this helps,
Yours,
ST.tAck
